ETYMOLOGY: Named after James Watt (1736–1819), the Scottish inventor and engineer whose improvements to the Newcomen steam engine were fundamental to the Industrial Revolution.
SINCE: 1882 (officially adopted by the Second Congress of the British Association for the Advancement of Science)

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The SI unit of power, equivalent to one joule per second, used to measure the rate of energy conversion or transfer.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 功率的国际单位（SI），等于每秒一焦耳，用于衡量能量转换或传输的速率。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The solar panel generates 300 watts under peak sunlight.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 该太阳能电池板在阳光充足时可产生300瓦特的功率。

REGISTER: Technical, General Science, Everyday use (for appliances)
